Eclectic variety of clientele that share one common cause... supporting local business. Just say no to Starbucks!

I can't believe I have lived down the street for three years and never tried this place. I knew they sold coffee but had no idea also offer amazing food and pastries. The BLT I just wolfed down was arguably the best I've ever had!!! Warm, thick bacon with deep red tomatoes and toasted wheat bread. Delicious and I ordered from my car and drove thru!!! The girl who helped me was a joy and this place has definitely stole my heart. Keep up the good work Copper Star!!!

Iced lavender mocha. Yes, really. I've never heard of such a thing. This is my second visit here and hey we're just as nice the second time. Phoebe, the barista who creates my drink (with almond milk and Hershey's milk chocolate syrup because it mixes in cold better than the Ghiradelli), said they make their own lavender syrup here from steeped lavender leaves. 

I also had a piece of banana nut bread which was delicious...and HUGE! Easily 2.5, size of Starbucks and 100% tastier. 

This place should definitely warrant a visit or ten. I just moved here from Cali and was looking for an artsy mom and pop place. This is it.

Love it.  We're from Washington state and we were getting desperate to find a real coffee house.   Excellent choice.   I had two shots of perfectly prepared mellow low acid espresso that was presented in an awesome demitasse with an equally awesome soda water "chaser."    The vegan pastry - had given up hope of finding any such thing in Phoenix - was awesome.   My husband is an obnoxious Washington state coffee missionary.   Likes to tell baristas how to make coffee.   No need to do that here.   They've got it down.     Great music.   Interesting indoor/outdoor seating arrangement and the whole place is an excellent use of an old garage.   We will be back!

I LOOOOOVE the environment
There's a clean energy here like none other
Lots of light

Buuuut I have yet to find a drink that I can say is better than average. The coffee is okay. The black tea is subpar. The chai is half decent.

Were it not for the atmosphere here, I'm not sure what I'd come for.

Lux has them beat in taste. But the clean and vibrant vibes here are great.
The owner is awesome, the employees rock, the goods are great, and that's just the inside!
Probably my favorite coffee spot in town. Their coffee is good and they're bagel sandwiches are delicious. My girlfriend and I always stop by if we are in the neighborhood

Friendly neighborhood coffee house in an interesting neighborhood.  Love their $2 LARGE (very large) green ice teas and that they are very generous with refills.  curry chicken salad sandwich is a tasty lunch on the run and i agree with the cupcake reviews.  (for an interesting meal, walk south a few doors to the frybread house then come back for after-meal coffee at Copper star).  

Sometimes live music on Friday nights.  I am mostly there in the evenings so am not sure of the atmosphere at other times of day.

Copper Star Coffee is not just a run-of-the-mill coffeehouse. It is a quiet and cozy neighborhood centered envirionment that was built on the lot of an newly renovated and converted old gas station. Locally owned, Copper Star is a good place to stop by for your traditional morning cup of joe or your extra particular espresso beverages. Also offering an array of specialty teas and fruit smooties, Copper Star is most notable in my book for their fresh, in house baked goods. I highly reccomend trying one of their frosted cupcakes...scruptious! In a hurry? Call in your order for pick up or use their drive-thru! Free wifi for customer use as well as long couches and lots of natural light, Copper Star is not too big, not too small, and perfect for those who want a mellow, non-pretentious, smoke-free place to drink coffee. 

One gripe: I do not reccomend their Chai tea lattes-- they seem too sweet for some reason. 

I do however, love their mochas and their antioxidant smoothies with pomegranates and Acai.

I usually don't like to add to a review pile-on, especially when all that needs to be said has been said. But in my effort to drink more local coffee, and less of The Siren's, I have to add my oh-two.

I dig Copper Star -- good coffee, friendly crew, a drive through. Heck, one time, I even got a free Powerball ticket there.

I only have one quibble, and it's a small one. I only mention it because I care. It's the excessive and cheesy signage.

I liked the little hand-painted sandwich board, that read, "drink local coffee." It fit perfectly with their local business vibe.

Now that sign has been repainted in a more generic manner, and moved to the side. In its stead is a gigantic white vinyl banner, on it, printed in stark, black, all caps "DRIVE THRU COFFEE."

Gag. 

So now there's the generic sandwich board, the huge banner, the flappy flags, and the neon in the window. 

I understand that they are trying to increase business. But now it's looking like a used car lot, and reeks of desperation. People don't like to patronize desperate business, because it's sad, and makes them feel sad too.

Please, Copper Star, dial it down a notch. Share your message with confidence, but without shouting. We will still love you!

EDIT: OK I stopped by the very next day, and the "DRIVE THRU COFFEE" banner was replaced by a huge red banner with all caps white lettering that reads, "SANDWICH KING OF 7TH AVE."

Ulgh.
I love this place. I have used the drive through as well as gone in and they have great brunch/lunch food and good drinks. Their chai is my favorite. They also offer almond milk which I prefer.

chill atmosphere, lots of natural light. the chai is ehh. Wi-Fi kinda slow (several users when I went).
bakery items were good and coffee is good. I go here to study.

It's hard to give them 4 instead of 5 stars, but only because they are great enough to be in the same conversation as Lux, Cartel, Giant, and Lola. What is amazing: service, the baked goods, the location, and the hours (one of the few places open at 6 AM). My only nit-pick is the coffee. It's mild for my taste, so I also add an espresso shot.

Very friendly employees and environment! Seems like everyone knows each other! I ordered a white mocha non fat milk ...tasty and sweet still but to me a little pricey was 5$ for the smaller size. Decent food selection offered.  I didn't try anything myself but someone with me did and enjoyed it. Inside space is a bit small as I  came here to study with a few people and wouldn't recommend going back for study group purposes.

While the scone was delicious the coffee was to be desired and as cool as the place seems you have to know someone behind the counter to get good service.  They had forgotten to make our sandwiches, did apologize and gave us 1 free drink card hmm seems like they could have done better. I don't believe ill be back again too bad some places live by reputation rather than quality!
Good place for coffee..the Cubano and tuxedo mocha is a must try if you want to try something different
Pretty nice service however, the drinks were mediocre, leaning more toward bad. The Thai iced tea was not a Thai iced tea I tried before in my favorite place.
Awesome menu! Great variety of drinks, pastries, sandwiches. Amazing service! Love the unique environment. A must stop when we're in the area.

First off, the atmosphere is pretty cool. It has a laid-back and indie kind of vibe going on. Lots of interesting people drinking their coffee, some students, some people having conversation--it's all good. I'm not a person that is bothered by the background noise of a coffee house (in fact, the noise helps me focus), hence why I frequent them to study. So why the three-star rating?

Atmosphere aside, this place was a little odd. It kind of feels like a sideshow of sorts and coffee house awkwardly pieced together....

1. When I walked up to the display counter I checked out the various muffins and cookies (which are monstrous). I placed an order for a mocha and then asked the person upfront what one of the cookies were, as there was no label for them. She looked at them, looked surprised and said that she didn't know and would have to ask someone to find out. Then she stood there and stared at me. After a few seconds she asked me if I wanted something. "Um.....yeah, I wanted to know what kind of cookie that is so I can figure out if I want to buy it...??" Duh. Seriously? Are you not going to sell me the cookie? Am I crazy to expect that you'll ask someone next to you if you don't know? Strange. 

2. The place was eerily quiet when I first sat. No music. No loud voices---people were basically quiet and doing their own thing, surprisingly. (usually there is that ONE loud person). But then something in the air stirred and this guy starts playing the trombone... okay, not bad (a little odd of an instrument choice, but I won't judge. Also, the jazzy music was pretty cool to study to.)...then another guy picks up a harmonica and mic....hmmm, interesting. Kind of folky, not bad....Annnddd then this guy starts singing and playing a guitar. Ok, seriously? Trombone, harmonica and guitar? And it seems like they are all playing three different songs. I pull up the coffee shop's website, nope, this little "musical adventure" is not listed on their calendar. So can random people play live music whenever or was I just privy to a special random performance? I mean it was around 4pm on a Sunday, so I wasn't expecting there to be any kind of live entertainment. 

Also, the disjointed music has now become a distraction (see, I've lost all concentration to study and started writing this review instead ::sigh::). 

3. Parking: there are like four parking spots? You have to park on the neighborhood side streets--not sure if there's a permit requirement or a free-for-all. So park at your own risk. 

4. On the plus side, the mystery cookie was pretty tasty and the coffee wasn't bad. I got the lavender mocha, it didn't really have any lavender taste (maybe they forgot it?), but I liked that it wasn't overtly sweet or syrupy. 

Overall, I'm not that impressed. If you're going to have live music--cool, just let your future patrons know through your website or some kind of sign. Also, your staff needs to get it together a little. They just seem like they're floating around, just hanging out behind the counter a little clueless.

Cute indie coffee shop. Nice staff. Usually get a drink to go but today decided to sit and take it in. Comfy place overall, but very weird use of space? There are two huge couches in the middle of the seating area- which essentially makes it so there is less seating overall. I'm not sure about you- but it exceeded my comfort level to sit on a couch in the middle of two strangers. Also- the purple couch has A LOT of city miles on it. Might be time
To retire it.
Coffee and food are always great. Can't always connect to the Wi-Fi though. Love this spot otherwise. Good vibes
Local First!!!  I is small but there is always a few local neighborhood regulars there and is becoming quite the gathering place for those that live in the area...

I really like that this place has a drive-thru.  Coffee is good and for the value, the sandwich was great as well.

I'll be back to enjoy this great locally owned business.

An awesome coffee shop! Good for going to study for a long time, meeting friends to talk, or listening to live music (Sundays). This is the main place I go to study, they have enough space to spread out and you can stay as long as you want. Very friendly staff!

They have very good ice coffee and drip with good cappuccinos as well. One of there best things is there baked goods, which are freshly made in-house every morning. (On your first visit they will give you any baked item for free). They have only a few food items, (bagel sandwich, vegan plate, curry salad/ wrap, hummus plate) but they are also all made in-house and very delicious. All prices are very reasonable. A coffee shop you need to check out in Phoenix.

The exposed wall and industrial-like atmosphere is nice. 

The coffee is good. 

The best thing about this place is the staff. Unlike the majority of independent coffee shops, they are extremely friendly and helpful.

I'm definitely a fan.

I had a horrible experience there. While I was waiting for my food, I noticed a couple of items just sitting there and I'd heard them calling names so people could pick up their orders. No one ever asked my name so I asked a woman working there how do I get my order. She very shortly said it'll be coming. I asked if I could get my iced tea first and she slammed her hand down on the counter and said very nastily we have many kinds of teas. I'm 61 and have never had this bad an experience. No matter how busy you are, if you can't treat customers professionally and cordially, maybe you need a different job.
I love this place. It is a perfect place to study (which is what I am doing) to just chill. Great coffee, super chill at atmosphere and workers. Great baked goods and food is quick.

Finally took a walk over to this place after living down the street for 1.5 years. Great selection of drinks, including non-coffee items, and an assortment of pastries and bagel sandwiches. Friendly, attentive staff even offered us free pastries to welcome us on our first visit. The seating area is larger than I'd guessed based on the size of the building, and the drive thru stayed pretty busy. Great neighborhood spot!

I went to Copper Star for my first time today. I love the laid back environment. The Barista was more than welcome to give me some recommendations when I told her it was my first time and even gave me a free pastry for my first visit. I had the Cubano iced and it was delicious!!. I definitely recommend this place to coffee lovers and for people that want to try something new and creative.

The atmosphere was really nice. Love the outdoor patio with the metal art and concrete/bottle table. Nice change from the chain coffee shop. Customers very friendly and talkative. My drink tasted yummy but it wasn't frozen enough otherwise I'd give them 5 stars.

This is my all time favorite coffee joint! I go at least once a week. 

The local hot spot hosts an assortment of amazing coffee choices, pastries and a couple of sandwiches in a relaxed, but thriving atmosphere. My coffee drink of choice is a 24 oz iced vanilla latte with only 2 pumps of vanilla and almond milk.

The staff and owner are super friendly, inquiring about your day and genuinely caring about every customer that walks through their door. It didn't take them long to learn my name and know my order, which creates an even better customer experience.

There is no going back to large coffee chains for me. If you are around this area of town, please stop in for a delicious coffee and sweet treat! Don't forget to ask for a punch card as well...you will be back.

I have mixed experiences here at Copper Star.  Overall, it's a really nice, hipster coffee place where I can study a bit and surf the webs.  

I can't offer feedback on the coffee because I'm a tea drinker.  It's the monster, refillable iced teas that keep me coming back.  They have several to choose from, and are very generous with the servings.  This is a very good thing in the summer time.  

The pastries are freakin' awesome.  Love the baked goods, except maybe for the bagels.  They're just ok.  Otherwise, if you love a great muffin, they have 'em.

The lunch items are a weak point.  I've eaten lunch here a few times, and I was never satisfied on any occasion.  The first time, they didn't have the ingredients necessary to make the meal, and tried to concoct some frankenwich that was just odd.  I ended up swapping it out for hummus plate that was just- meh.  The second time, I ordered the turkey sub. Again- meh.  Today, the veggie sandwich.  It wasn't very good, and it didn't have the same ingredients listed on the menu.  Also, the lunches don't come with chips or salads or any type of side.  Go elsewhere for food.

Other than that, it's a great place to chill out and study.  It's also a nice stop-in while I get my dog grooomed.

I've been coming here for over a year now, and it has become my favorite neighborhood coffee shop. Between excellent service, delicious coffee, and a great patio, this has become a weekly must for me. The only things that would makes it better would be a proper bike rack and regular vegan pastry options.

The coffee is good, the sandwiches are great and the cupcakes are amazing! It's hit or miss on seating. I have know some people who have had a hard time connecting to their wifi but I haven't had any problems.

I really enjoy the ambiance of this coffee shop and the lavender mocha is a dream. Their drinks are fast but sometimes their food takes a long time. 

My biggest thing though is that the staff/customer service is very hit or miss. Sometimes they are very friendly and pleasant. Other times they just stare at you and wait for you to say what you want. Today however they were really rude and literally slammed their hand on the counter when my mom politely asked if her iced tea was coming, which was taking an unreasonable time to get. The behavior was very uncalled for, obnoxious, unwarranted, and off putting. It made me sad to see, since I'm a regular and like to shop local, but think I'll go to starbucks next time.
When I'm looking for the more mature, laid back version of Lux, I come to Copper Star. Coffee is not as good but service is great and place is inviting. Great neighborhood favorite.

Pure perfection! I highly recommend the Iced Cubano and Breakfast Bagel sandwich. 
Goodbye Starbucks... Hello Copper Star!

I love that this is an old gas station.  Hooray for recycling buildings into something new rather than tearing them down.  I've been a fan of this place since it opened.  Today I tried the applesauce spiced vegan cupcake, and it was pretty amazing.  You should try it too!

I like the creativity of using the old gas station for "drive thru coffee". People are nice, coffee is good, and the wifi is free so overall, this place works. Good place to grab coffee before or after class or to do homework, for those who are GCU students. The Americano is always a good option if you're not sure what to get.

We had the best experience at this funky, friendly little coffee shop in the Melrose neighborhood of Phoenix! The staff was so kind, and appreciated that we brought our own coffee cups. They gave us a free pastry since it was our first time in (haven't eaten it yet, but it looks like a mighty fine Cranberry Pecan Scone). We got a breakfast bagel (sesame bagel, honey ham, egg, no cheese), and it was delicious. The coffee is great & is doing its job as we're on the road to Cali. We will definitely be back the next time we're coming through PHX!
Definitely one of my favorite coffee spots in the valley! Copper Star is very chill, down to earth, & has the smoothest coffee! My favorite drink is the cubano hands down!
Always enjoyed my coffee and service here. They make a great blended caramel coffee. Service could be a tad faster. Still 5 stars

Another yelper mentioned their litmus test of basic coffee to see how good the joint is. My personal test is a white mocha/velvet/whateverplacescallmydecadentescapeinacupthatsbadformeandIdon'tcare. It is very easy to get a poorly poured, improperly mixed, poorly portioned white mocha, either bitter, too sweet, etc etc. Every time I came into Copper Star, it's perfect. If I am away from my house, this is where I go.

Really liked the vibe at copper star cafe. It's a hidden gem in my opinion. It has an authentic coffee shop feel. It does not feel like several other coffee shops in the valley which are trying to be hipster. Copper star coffee is hipster! The live music was awesome. There is indoor and outdoor seating. Staff is friendly, customers are friendly. Even made a new friend. One of the best coffee shops in the valley.
First time today and will not be the last. Friendly and that counts during a morning rush. Thanks !
First time at this cafe and loved it! Coffee was great, staff super friendly, inviting and comfortable ambiance. Already looking for an excuse to stop by again.

It's an okay coffee shop, they have wifi but didn't take advantage of it.. Kinda mellow but nothing amazing as far as ambiance goes. The mocha was decent, not spectacular. Since I live downtown I probably will go check out Cartel or Jobot if I really need my coffee fix. Both are closer and probably feel and look cleaner than this joint, they should air it out a little bit..smelt kind of ripe mixed with the coffee beans lol ..just saying!

3 stars

i've been to copper star since it first opened, pre-yelp days for me and my locavore ways were still being established but eversince my first copper star experience I've been in love with this coffeehouse. I just love their place, the former gas station turned coffeehouse makes this place as one of the places i bring out of town guests to show them that Phoenix does have its little gems and 7th ave or "melrose" is just quaint. Anywho, I've had good chai here, and yummy creamy nonfat vanilla lattes but only recently did I try a pastry treat. The lady behind the counter was a sweetheart and she made me feel extra special when she liked my "human" shirt and asked who designed it... yes that day i was proud to be a Gay Black Woman... as my shirt starts off with. I bought myself the nonfat vanilla latte with carrot cake cupcake that had what seemed was an extra dollop of cream cheese frosting, DeLISH! it was truly carrotrific, and the cupcake provided a great sweetness kick to go with my extra caffeinated beverage. Copper Star may not be a Lux with it's urban chic interior, or the real bohemian interior of Lola on Roosevelt or the hipster cool of Cartel in Tempe, no, Copper Star is simply cool with its venue and hold its own with its great drinks, coffees and treats, so hence Copper Star is truly a coffeehouse star!

This place is awesome. Just moved to this area from California not too long ago and I'm stoked Copper Star Coffee exists. I'm pretty basic when it comes to a cup of Joe, but I know what I like, and this place has it. The fact that you can drive through is amazing, and the inside is really cool too. It has a hip, if not classic "coffee shop" vibe, but cozy and inviting all at the same time. The menu isn't overwhelming, has all the classics you expect at a great coffee spot, with some specialty items as well (the lavender mocha is pretty awesome). 

I recommend. Convenient, quality coffee and great service.

Fun place. Cute, hip environment!  There is a very competitive coffee environment in downtown (between Lola, Lux, Giant, Fair Trade, Hob Nobs, JoBot, etc.)- but they are definitely making their mark! A relaxed place to hang out, talk or study. It has more of a "rustic" feel than some other coffee shops. I can't wait to go back.

I'm originally from Phoenix's Encanto District. Whenever I'm back in town visiting my parents, it's a pleasure to come back to Copper Star Coffee.

Part of the reason to head to Copper Star is the ambiance: it's a converted vintage gas station with a quirky, welcoming feel. Light streams in through the glass-paneled garage door and, with the cafe's tall ceilings, the space feels at once very large and very cozy. I've come here to work in the past, but unlike some coffee shops, Copper Star is never completely overrun by laptops. There are always pairs or groups of friends here having a good time. Nevertheless, if productivity is what you want, the shop is never too loud, there's free WiFi, and there are a couple plugs along the west wall. I've definitely had some productive afternoons tinkering away at one of their long communal tables. 

The quality of service at Copper Star has consistently been excellent. The folks are nice, approachable, and ready to help, and interacting with them has always been a joy. The coffee is good -- I'm a no-fuss, black coffee girl, but trust them about the iced cappuccino on really hot days -- and, if you're more of a tea person, they're one of the few places nearby that stock Harney & Sons, one of my favorite tea blenders in the US. I've had a couple pastries and the veggie sandwich, and they were delicious.

In sum: If you're a Phoenician in need of a charming, quality coffee shop in your neighborhood to spend time with friends or solo, go to Copper Star.  You're welcome.

This was only my second time at Copper Star Coffee. Both times I used their drive thru. I'm not really a coffee drinker, but sometimes I crave some sort of sweet & delicious coffee concoction! Because I am not an avid coffee drinker, I left it up to the barista. She made a delicious drink for me & I asked her how I should order it the next time I came. She said it was a "Dulce de Leche iced latte, with 4 shots of espresso". I was very thankful. 
Today, I left the house craving that same drink.  I sat in the drive thru for a bit & this woman comes out so I asked if I can have an "Iced Dulce de Leche latte". I fumbled my words a bit & she gave me a squished up, disgruntled look & said, like a complete bitch, "You want an iced dulshaylaayche latte?" Totally making fun of the way I messed up my words. So I repeated syllable by syllable & she still had that stupid condescending squinty look on her face & said "So you mean CARAMEL?!". I had enough. I wasn't there to be belittled by a miserable woman who clearly hates her job. I understand that coffee is her first language, but it isn't mine. I am a customer & I shouldn't be made to feel like I am an inconvenience to your place of business by ordering a basic iced latte. I told her to forget about it & started to pull away. Of course her snarled lips & squinty, annoyed face immediately dropped and she started telling me to stay. Too little, too late, you miserable woman. Find a new job.

I've written other reviews in the past and I have contributed MANY pics (one of a frozen fountain went viral in my FB purview). I've been a patron since they opened their doors. It took them a while, and I remember driving past every day to work, south on 7th, on my way to my position of public service (as a dedicated state employee) watching that sign (opening soon) for months and months wondering WHEN they would finally open.

Anyway, I noticed a couple of less than favorable reviews in Yelp and though I dont challenge their accuracy, and though there are MANY excellent 5 star reviews I feel compelled to reiterate some observations.

The owner (and his Board of Director(s)) rescued a dilapidated gas station and invested money to redeem and try to retain the integrity of the neighborhood feel of the original building.

The bathrooms have some interesting design, by a local. (I had started a list of PHX bathrooms of note on Foursquare and then got distracted -- the former Florist and the former/current Christopher's had some interesting ones.)

The bakers in the past AND present have/do all create delightful confections (though I continue to petition for more savory).

The interior ambiance is sufficient. And has gone through some changes over time to meet the whims of customers and ownership.

The landscape is maintained by a local who is also a patron.

The cute little fireplace is stoked by a local, whenever he chooses to come by, and feels like doing it.

This is a dog friendly place and I love all the dogs that frequent it.

The owner...he cares about what he does and he is quite engaged in his neighborhood and his community. This coffee shop, this project, is something he CHOOSES to do. He is supported by his Board of Director(s) because of the service this small business contributes to others.

So, remember that there are NO automatons here. What is here is a choice, despite health, wealth, hassle, obstruction or disappointments.

Thank you to the staff, management, operations, ownership (and Board of Directorship) for keeping on--keeping on.

The setting is very cool and the coffee is good. The ONLY reason I gave it three stars is that there were so many flies inside, we finally took our drinks and left. My friend and I hadn't seen each other in awhile and we were looking forward to spending some time talking and chilling, but the utterly annoying flies landing on every exposed part of us every other minute made enjoyment impossible. I have no idea if this is normal here, and I apologize if it's not...but it certainly was the day we decided to visit.

DANG IT! my cubano was so good!! 

it was recommded to me by the carhop. i wanted something on the sweeter side that was also strong. this came with 2 shots of espresso, cinnamon and milk. it was perf.

i also liked the car hop. he was so cool. i told him it was my first time so he did jazz hands as a welcome. 

i also picked up a chai latte for my friend and she said it was amazeballs.
I really enjoyed this small coffee shop.  The espresso had a nice smooth flavor.  The space is very cool, and the environment is very laid back.  I went on open mic night.  Had a lot of fun.

Eeeeeeeee.  Fool me once, shame on me.  Fool me twice, shame on me, yet again.  I keep wanting to love Copper Star for many reasons, but just can't get over that one major issue I have each time.

Upon giving Copper Star another shot, met with the same results we were.  I guess it should be a hint when a coffee shop gets awarded Best of Phoenix for their muffins and baked goods, but never a mention about the coffee?  That's kind of how it feels here.

The baked goods are quite good.  The cupcakes and muffins are very fresh, almost shockingly.  The place itself is quaint, delightful and has a very neat look - great idea with the gas station theme.  Coffee itself though, I could do without.  Automatic pulled shots that were well over 40 seconds.  Cappuccino that wavered between watery and milky, to a faint, faint background of burnt-roast-taste.

CSC is probably one of the better places to get a baked good in town.  If coffee is really your thing though, head east a half mile.

Awesome coffee, cool staff. Really artistic inside and the place use to be a gas station. 

On your first visit you get a free pastry and they are amazing!! 

I highly recommend it.  Don't know why this place doesn't have 5 stars!
wish they had a 10 star button. What a great place. great staff and great drinks. oh and you have to try their cinnamon rolls...............OMG good...great atmosphere just a great staff.

Came by with my boyfriend, who is here visiting from Canada, and we ordered our drinks and cinnamon roll just to find out it's their 11 year anniversary so FREE DRINKS!!!! Wowza. This place is amazing!
5 stars for aesthetics alone. kudos to copper star for beautifying a former gas station. They always have interesting art and cool vibes. Good place to get work done.

I love this place.  I come here everyday for coffee... just about:)  The staff is very nice, they get to know their customers and remember their drinks.  They start making my coffee before i even say a word.  On saturdays and sundays i will indulge in the various flavors of croissants or scones and they are so delicious!
Absolutely delicious! Customer service is amazing and the coffee exceptionally flavorful and tastes like how coffee should taste.
My fave coffee shop in Phoenix! They make their own chai and it's DELICIOUS.

"Buy Local Coffee" is what a sign out front of this establishment says.  So that's what I did.  I went to Copper Star Coffee to get my drink of choice, an iced coffee with cream.  I enjoyed the flavor.  It was better than Starbucks and quite a few cents cheaper.  SCORE!!!  I became a regular.  I stuck with my ice coffee for months but their bakecase was calling my name every time I would enter.  I found out Copper Star bakes their own pastries fresh daily.  Another SCORE!!!  No preservatives or high fructose corn syrup.  I started adding a scone with my iced coffee.  They have chocolate chip, lemon, blueberry, etc.  Delicious!!!  The apple sauce spice cake is now my favorite.  It is a vegan pastry.  It is flavorful and the glaze is so slight but fantastic.  Not a vegan by the way.  

I have been slowly branching out among the Copper Star menu.  Try the Black Cherry Limeade.  The specialty coffee drinks are quite good too.  The blended toffee drink rocks.  The antioxidant smoothie is refreshing.  The other smoothies are okay.  They use syrup in those.  I don't know how healthy that makes them.  (Real fruit please).

Let's talk about their sandwiches now shall we.  I have tried their sesame tuna, the curry chicken, the deviled egg salad, and the veggie.  All of them are winners.  You wont be disappointed.  Copper Star just unveiled there new sub sandwiches as well.  They use a local butcher's sausages for their subs.  Awesome.  Way to keep it in the community.

-internet access
-community board
-art work
-misters for the heat
-water bowl for dogs
-drive thru car hop service
-frequent customer stamp card

The Copper Star building is an old service station cleverly gutted out and made super cool.  The staff is great and they stick around.  Not a high turn over.  It must be a great place to work.

Parking can be tricky.  The majority of the parking is on the street and the parked customer cars creep into the surrounding neighborhood.  You may have a little walk.  Big Woop!

A must.  Check it out.

It's my first time here and I'm definitely coming back! It's a cute little coffee shop, great space for studying and/or meeting someone to catch up. The coffee is AMAZING and I had a chocolate coconut scone that was super yummy! I love the vibe this coffee spot has and the employees were great! I had mentioned to the cashier that it was my first time here and she gave me my scone for free! Such a nice gesture especially when I was only planning on grabbing a coffee with plans to study! I got a 16 oz iced Tuxedo with almond milk.  I LOVE that they have alternative options to milk. She warned me that if I was vegan the powder in the tuxedo wasn't all vegan which I appreciated because if I was vegan I would want to know that.  Overall awesome experience and cool retro with a modern twist coffee shop vibe!! I just heard someone order a breakfast sandwich I definitely will have to try one next time! They have punch cards and they have a drive thru! Even though I really would recommend stepping inside and taking a look around!
Copper star has the best chai tea lattes, and they don't charge extra for soy milk.

This local Coffee shop is just a few blocks from where I live. I'm not that hard to please. I simply want good service and fabulous coffee. I get both at this place. Love the free wifi. Sometimes I go here just to get away and catch up with online stuff/emails. Give it try. ~X~

I am always...always...{did I mention ALWAYS} on the hunt for a perfect cup of coffee? 

So when we walked in, not only was there quaint patio seating, the inside of the shop with cozy AND there was a band playing!  On a weekend morning...When does that even happen? ...in real life?

Right, back on track, the coffee -- today I got a cold brew -- and you know  good cold brew (for me anyway) only requires a little bit of cream, or dairy of choice, for it to perfectly balance and they hit it SPOT ON.

The baristas were so relaxed {coffee shop vibes} and quick. My fellow coffee consumers were either studying, relaxing and listening to the music or outside socializing.  There was no rush from anyone..it was perfect.

For the people looking for the perfect place to socialize without a hustle bustle of traffic or people, this is your gem. 

//cheers//

Loved my cappuccino and gluten free muffin, delish, comfy couches and free wifi, very clean, friendly staff. Really nice experience. It's right next to Wagnwash on 7th ave. Gluten free muffin tasted like a regular delicious muffin

This is nice, lil coffee bar, good to study, bcz their music isn't too loud and if is it, they can turn it down for u. Also they do have a great coffee, is strong and tasty, better that in starbucks. The people that comes here is a lil bit different from other coffees that I like to go, but the ambient is quite and relaxing.... I WOULD SAY YES COME HERE AND ENJOY A GOOD COFFEE, STUDY AND HAVE A CONVERSATION BCZ IT IS NICE!!!
It's like Lux, but smaller, and that's ok. Cool vibe, good coffee.

This place is a gem! I've been searching for the best chai latte in town and I think I've found it here. It's a delicious fresh blend they make themselves. Just the right amount of spicy and sweet. The manager who served me was super nice and I even received a complimentary muffin because it was my first time here! how cool is that! I love the vibe in this place as well. I will definitely be coming back!
By far one of the most original ideas for a coffee shop. Good atmosphere and local art on display. The coffee? Delish with a hint of awesome. Highly recommended. By me. Because that's what I do.

I'd definitely come back here if I lived closer... Really cute, welcoming atmosphere and good prices.  The iced tea comes in an enormous cup with free refills.  I try to avoid evil styrofoam so I asked for it in the somewhat smaller plastic cup, which was like a normal Large.  The guy charged me half the price and still gave a free refill (I can't believe I finished the first one but it was really good iced tea!).  There was a cut-up chocolate cupcake at the register for people to sample, which tasted like a rich brownie.  All of the cupcakes and other desserts looked homemade and delicious but sadly I had to refrain.  The street parking wasn't bad when I was there - no meters to worry about, at least.

I truly regret having to post this review. I'm giving this place five stars, so it doesn't negatively affect the score. However, there is one employee in particular who I've just reached my limit with. The only reason I'm complaining about him on here is out of a concern for the shop's well-being. I fear that if a customer were to come to Copper Star for the first time when he is working they would form an entirely inaccurate opinion of this wonderful place. 

I don't know his name, but he is usually there for closing shifts. He has a septum piercing, and tends to wear a look on his face of utter disdain every time I step through the door. 

As a fellow barista: I get it. Dealing with the public can be rough. Therefore, when I interact with anyone in customer service I'm extremely tolerant of grumpiness. People have bad days. That being said, this particular barista has NEVER been pleasant out of the upwards of five times that I have been to the shop while he's working. 

I truly, truly love this place and hope that this review is understood purely to be an effort to help. The pastries are amazing, and literally every other barista is fantastic.
Get the cubano! This place is great and local. Drive thru has a rustic feel as the location once served as a gas station. 5 copper stars!
Best coffee, speedy service, and everyone is in a great mood. I love stopping here.

One of those small places that can really hold its own. Parking is very limited and they share a very small lot, so there is the luck factor if you're driving in. The decor and atmosphere is great. Such a neighborhood coffee shop. I ordered a caramel blended drink and it was REALLY good. Totally recommend and worth every star.

I have been meaning to post a review for this location for some time now. Better late than never, right ? I give this place a hands down 5 stars mostly because of the interaction I witnessed between the owner and his customers one morning. Nice guy! I am not a ritual coffee drinker, but this place is in my hood and it has such a relaxed feel to it. I can tell you guys that the few times I have ordered a coffee at Copper Star I didn't need a nap that day. If I drink coffee it's not for the flavor but because I have stuff I want/need to get done that day. It worked.

I tend to be in the group that's more lukewarm about this place. It's not bad by any means at all. I love the location and the set-up of the place, but I don't think their pastries and non-coffee drinks are anything special. I don't drink coffee, so I guess I'm missing half of what they have to offer. Regardless, this is a great place to go chill and have a conversation at.

This place is five blocks from my house and I really should make a habit of coming here a bit more. I tend to hit up Lux more often, but I think this place offers a more homey feel. Lux is cool, but ultimately you feel like you're eating/drinking in an art space and Copper Star is more of a place to get cozy and do your homework over a cup of tea. Anyway, definitely check this place out because it's become a fixture of sorts in the upper central part of downtown and on First Fridays.

A neat local Phoenix coffee shop. Adding to the charm, it used to be a full-service gas station. Now it's a delicious little coffee shop that has car hops. These nice gals will take your order and bring you delicious, tasty caffeinated beverages. And homemade pastries and muffins to go along with. Don't forget the Italian sodas!
Great coffee, wonderful food and an awesome staff.  One of my favorite coffee shops, if not my favorite.

This place is quite a drive from where I am but I don't even mind. We came here after a friend of mine recommended that I go check it out since I absolutely love all things coffee! My wife and I decided to go one day after craving a nice iced coffee other than the usual chain spots. We were greeted as soon as we walked up to the counter and we ordered our coffees. We were told that we could have a free pastry each since it was our first time which was awesome. I chose the rice crispy treat (my favorite) which was gooey and delicious. I love the vibe here is laid back and chill. I highly recommend anybody who loves coffee and a cool environment to check this place out!

Now my favorite coffee shop! House coffee is always hot and fresh - something missing from most neighborhood coffee shops, unfortunately. I enjoyed a scone - best scone I've had in a long time - dry, as it should be - not soggy/soft as is my typical experience at other shops. Relaxing, comfortable atmosphere - attracts a mature crowd - which I like. College kids are in the minority - which is great! And, finally, the staff is super nice and attentive - something missing from 80% of all shops.

I loved the environment (quiet and sleek) and the coffee was good enough, but Copper Star's free wireless internet was completely maddening. I'd hoped to do some work, but an endless parade of disconnects drove me to more friendly internet confines at Lola's, which was a shame, because I wanted a sandwich.

First impression: holy crap, this Cubano and brownie are A-MAZING! There's an eclectic vibe in here, with music playing that adds to the ambience but is not too loud to have a conversation, local art is for sale on one wall, and then there is random art and a mixture of large tables, bar stools, tables for 2, and a couple couches. Definitely a unique place to hang with friends and enjoy a cup of great coffee!

Came here for a quick coffee and pastry. 

Amazing coffee, best I've had in some time, and coffee is literally all I drink. The blueberry muffin was fantastic as well.

Very, very pleasant staff. Great, quick service and no attitude. 

Cool location, both outdoor and indoor seating with some great art. Reasonable prices.

Highly recommend!

Rating: 4.5 Stars. A real, true, legitimate coffee shop!

What I Liked: Coffee was decent (ordered an Iced Mocha). The fresh-out-of-the-oven Cheese Danish was AMAZING though...and definitely worth a trip back. The atmosphere was peaceful, the staff was friendly, and I LOVE that they bake their own goods in-house (a rarity these days).

Room For Improvement: The coffee was decent...it was good...but I was hoping for outstanding. I prefer a stronger, smokier roast. Also, the wi-fi was deplorable. It was beyond intermittent--it would be on for one minute, then off for 5. Very frustrating.

Overall: If they improved their internet, and I ordered stronger drinks from them, then Copper Star is/would be the perfect coffee shop. I'm a fan; if you live anywhere nearby, you owe it to yourself to frequent this place. ...Why can't we have a real coffee shop like this in Ahwatukee!?!
I spent 5 weeks out of the country and the first place I spent money upon my return is this home away from home. It's a great location, yummy products, priced right, and a fabulous staff!

I'm okay with this spot.  First and foremost, thank you to the employee who (when she found out it was my first time stopping in) gave me my lavender mocha on the house.  That sort of friendliness and service is what many places lack!!! This place has the potential to be great.  I liked the music variety overhead, and the variety of small and large tables. And, of course, the staff was super chill, which is always a good thing.

The downsides: it had a funky smell.  I am not sure if it was the open kitchen concept - but it wasn't a familiar or the most pleasant smell.  Unfortunately, one of the coffee house guests was singing to himself (he has every right to! and this isn't the coffee houses job to tell him otherwise!), but it just disrupted my steady study mode... I will add that their restroom was not horrible, but it also wasn't as neat as I usually like to tolerate - it could use some fixin' up.

However, it's cool. The lavender mocha was more legit than I expected (I have never had a lavender drink in my life), and their baked goods looked amazing - try the no-bake cookie (but share it with a friend!)

We used to love Copper Star. The owner Bill is fantastic and we wish him all the best. Unfortunately for the last six months almost every one of our orders came out wrong. Either something is missing from the order, wrong bagel or wrong sandwich, iced instead of hot, etc. The food is very good and when the coffee is what we ordered, excellent. At this point we have to try a new coffee shop. We have tried for months with Copper Star but now we feel like the staff is on pins and needles with us because of the past mistakes. This is uncomfortable and quite frankly there are too many options in Phoenix to be dissatisfied. Maybe someday we will go back but not for a while.

Stopped into this super cute shop Sunday morning for a coffee and a bagel. The staff was very attentive, the coffee was piping hot and delicious, the sesame bagel
They toasted for me was bit short on cream cheese and overall I had a wonderful experience. I will be coming here on a regular basis now that I live on this side of town!

This place was great!  It's located in a converted gas station. I ordered the tuxedo mocha (normally I am a strict coffee only guy) it was amazing. Not too sweet. My wife only gets nonfat lattes but the foam on her latte was thick and creamy. We also got a molasses cookie that was soft, chewy and delicious.  I cannot wait to get back to that side of town.  It was a perfect little coffee date place.
Friendly atmosphere, cool decor, good iced tea and iced chai, great bagels and tasty cupcakes!  I had some trouble logging onto their WiFi, but my computer tends to be petulant.

What a charming little coffee shop! I'm in love! I recently moved into the neighborhood with my boyfriend and we are so excited to be spending time here! The venue is nostalgic of times long gone, the baristas are so nice and so helpful, the bathrooms are always clean and the product is tasty! Best of all *drum roll please* DOG FRIENDLY PATIO! I will definitely be frequenting this place- if you haven't tried it yet, you're missing out!

Copper Star is a drive-thru and sit-down coffee shop that serves locally roasted, fresh, hot coffee, frozen coffee drinks, smoothies and fresh baked goods. They also have a few sandwiches and a delicious hummus plate that comes with kalamata olives and warm pita bread. I think they now have a daily homemade soup as well. And during the last holiday season, the owners wife was spotted making homemade pumpkin pies! I don't think anything on the menu is more than $5.50. 

Nice atmosphere, not too crowded, not too loud. Free wifi - the password is on the wall above the hallway to the restrooms. A great neighborhood place to hang out, but you can also drive through. Great service. Cheerful staff. Delicious goods. And you can feel good about supporting local business instead of a huge soulless chain. The owner, Bill, is super friendly.

My one gripe is they have had the same two couches and red lounge chairs pretty much since they opened, but I don't think they have EVER cleaned them. They now look disgustingly filthy and I'm always shocked when I see someone actually go sit down at them. I can't sit over there, I have to keep to the wood chairs and tables. I go to Copper Star once a week, but the filth on the fabric covered seating is grossing me out enough that I may reduce my visits until they have the upholstery cleaners come in.

I hate it when I wake up early on a Saturday! I mean, the one day of the week when I don't have to set the alarm and I can sleep as long as I like, and BOOM, wide awake at 7 anyway! Theoretically, I know I should be take advantage of the cooler morning temperatures and mow my lawn, but that's what Sundays are for, right? If you ask me, Saturday mornings are much better suited for relaxing and sipping coffee. Thankfully, I live just down the street from Copper Star Coffee (and luckily for my dog, Copper Star is right next door to Wag 'n Wash). The setup of this place is perfect, super cute converted gas station, and plenty of space on the patio for my pup to play greeter. You can get pretty much any kind of coffee/espresso drink you like, but I really dig the plain 'ol brewed coffee. Oh, and don't get me started on the tasty treats ogling me from their strategic position inside the glass case. The pastries are so yummy and cupcakes are irresistible (and share-with-a-friend-enormous). 
Hmm, on second thought, waking up early on a Saturday may just be my body's way of telling me get to Copper Star before they run out of chocolate raspberry croissants.

Stopped by when I needed to kill time before going back to office and ordered an iced Cubano and a breakfast sandwich.  The Cubano was really good and the customer service was good.  They have free water you can help yourself to and free Wi-Fi.  It can get crowded in the mornings, I was there before 8:30am on a Wednesday and it was a little empty but soon filled up quick with large groups so really wasn't enough space for people wanting to work on laptops afterwards.  I enjoyed the vibe of the place and the espresso so would definitely return if I am in the area again.
Great Lavender Coffee. Great vibe to the place. Being my first time there, they gave me a free pastry of choice: a large brownie! If I was from Phoenix, I would def hang out here
Super friendly people who work here and great coffee! Couldn't ask for better! Much rather give my money to a local small busy owner than a franchise. Gotta love it!

Best part of this place its in Melrose, my neighborhood. Support local business. Amazing coffee selection and breakfast items. Vegan Bill is yummy, BLT is oh so good (they are very generous with the bacon), and the egg breakfast bagel is yummy.

Great atmosphere!  It may be an acquired taste for Starbucks drinkers such as myself.  I'll admit I usually drink iced NF sugar-free vanilla lattes with whip at Starbucks.  I told the barista and he was very nice about trying to make a similar coffee concoction.  (Are they "baristas" everywhere? Sounds so pretentious.) I'd like to say I loved his version but it wasn't as sweet.  (I know, I'm a huge sweet tooth spoiled by corporate coffee peddlers.) My mom usually gets a Venti White Chocolate Frappuccino so the barista whipped up something similar but she also felt hers wasn't sweet enough.  I say hey, check the place out, the atmosphere's GREAT and the staff sure does try but if you like your coffee drinks sweet be forewarned, they may not taste sweet enough.
Super cool spot to get some java and check email. Great prices locally owned. Very cool art work that switches out every month.
Whatever to Copper Star? It used to be so good. The desserts are hit or miss but mostly miss. The outside area is never clean or swept.

Dear Copperstar, I really, really wanna love you... But I can't! 
I've done the drive-thru, to-go and dine-in- once each, and I've been left wanting every time. The place is so cute- chic, trendy, neat eclectic decor that is so in right now. Staff are equally eclectic, laid back and downright adorable. 
Unfortunately, the coffee sucks. Extremely acidic and fruity- just not my style at all, and I'm a Starbucks-everyday kinda girl. I also tried the blackberry-peach muffin and the cashew-white chocolate cookie, and both were over-baked- very dry. Tasty, yes. Yummy, no. 
I was there with a friend who ordered a Thai iced tea, which was mostly milk. After drinking almost half, she went up to the counter to ask for more tea, expecting to pay the 50-cent refill charge. They took her dollar bill, did not apologize for the weak drink and gave her no change.

I'd like to say I'll be back, but I won't, not after 3 disappointing visits. 
I want to support local businesses- but I can't force down stuff that doesn't taste good. :(

Is it possible to have a crush on a coffeeshop?

This place is, by far, my favorite new discovery in ages.  I've been driving past it on my way to and from work for ages but never had the time to stop in.  I have friends who rave about the place and go regularly, so I really wanted to check it out.  I finally did this past Saturday (5/31) and I scolded myself for not having done so sooner.

My friend and I found a parking space out back in the tiny parking lot and walked in not really knowing what to expect.  One patron sat at a table with her laptop and the rest of the place was empty.  The friendly girl at the counter took our orders and gave her own recommendations for cool drinks.  I took her up on her suggestion of a peach smoothie.  It was wonderful - like drinking pureed peaches!  I took a sip of my friend's latte and knew I would be ordering one of my own at some point in the near future.  Before taking our drinks, my eyes lingered over the cupcakes on display; I must admit I drooled a bit.

Because it was such a nice night, we sat outside and enjoyed our drinks.  It wasn't long before more people showed up.  A group of older folks joined us outside and a few other groups and couple settled inside.  My mind kept going back to the cupcakes I saw earlier, and I ended up going inside to buy one.  My choices were vanilla, red velvet, lemon, and strawberry (I think).  Not only were the cupcakes quite sizeable, but they had sprinkles - goldfish and piggies!  Very nice touch.  I ended up selecting a vanilla funfetti cupcake with bright blue icing and goldfish sprinkles.  It wasn't anything spectacular - just a cupcake made from a box cake mix - but it was a very nice treat and that much more special due to the fishies.  I know - it doesn't take much to make me happy.

I've since been back twice and have used the very convenient drive-thru.  The first time, the man who came out to greet me asked if I had my stamp card after he took my order.  When I told him I didn't, he told me he would give me one, and he did - along with three stamps!  that morning I had another peach smoothie and decided to try the red velvet cupcake.  The smoothie was just as ood as the first, but this cupcake was VERY tasty - much better than the vanilla funfetti.  I stopped again this morning and ordered a vanilla latte.  That sucker far surpassed the vanilla lattes I usually get at Starbucks.

I love supporting local businesses, and I'm only too happy to return to Copper Star time and again.  I suggest you do, too!

This place is so cute. So my best friend and I were originally gonna go somewhere else but it was 21 and over and she's not. Then we tried to go to Jobot. But we didn't realize it was First Friday and I didn't want to be in the mix of that. Too busy and too crowded for my liking. Well she found this place. Apparently it used to be a gas station. It looks like it might be drive through. But it's trendy/hipster and I love it. It's a smaller place but that's still cool. Also when it's your first time, you get a free pastry. So that's pretty awesome! I got a chai cupcake and my best friend got a oatmeal cookie. Both of which are big! Lol so I recommend splitting or saving for later. The coffee is good. I got a white mocha iced latte. My best friend doesn't like coffee so she got a coke lol. But it was in one of the older bottles so that was cool. It's in downtown Phoenix but it's not like the most ghetto part of Phoenix either. I was very pleased with my experience here. I can't wait to come back again!

My boyfriend and I decided to go to Copper Star Coffee after reading reviews on Yelp.  It wasn't a hard sell because I'm a huge fan of cupcakes.  And many of the reviewers were raving about the cupcakes, so I had to try one.  We both loved the coffehouse.  Great drinks, great prices, and yummmmyyyyy cupcakes.  My boyfriend read his book and I did some work on my laptop.  The environment was cozy and comfortable.  I definitely will be coming back again.

First time to Phoenix!  Read great reviews about this coffee shop. The mocha lavender is smooth and lives up to the hype!  My first time to this coffee shop, I didn't get a complementary pastry which I read about in a few reviews, however, my tip amount on my credit card transaction was generously changed from $1 to $6. It could just be a mistake or it could be someone fraudulently overcharging manual credit card receipts to cushion tip amounts. Whatever the case, I can't get a reply or response from the management of the shop as phone calls and emails go unanswered. PLEASE REFUND THE TIP AMOUNT as generally I don't tip $6 for a cup of joe, regardless of how delicious it was. Maybe this review will get a reply. I'll copy it so I can post it on every site. Here is to hoping someone resolves the issue. Cheers.
Ok, I tried the drip instead of the espresso this time. It was drinkable. I'm too scarred from the last time I tried the espresso to give it another chance.
Nice place.  I took my whole family on a Saturday night.  Great friendly laid back place.  Try the lavender mocha.  The wait staff even had a nice time helping the staff out with some deliveries.
Yaaaaaaaassss! Amazing customer service, local not conglomerate, best BLT. And the bathrooms are pretty cool too. Parking can be dicey but it's worth looking for a spot.

.. it's  an independent coffee shop .. which starts out at 5 stars just for not being Starbucks ! Ok I know sometimes that ain't enough ..  so here we go 

Service - excellent ! Super friendly staff.. did I say super .. yes super friendly staff who try to make it a point to remember your name and even your drinks. I have only been here the mornings and early noon so I'm not sure if they have anything going on at night/ evenings . 

The drinks are great and they are more than willing to listen if you want your drink one way or another. The place is clean and cozy .. which in real estate speak means not the biggest ! :) 

Free wifi , so yayy. Welcoming to anyone and everyone - more win. 

The restrooms are crazy clean and definitely wins for the fact they are comfy and spacious enough to change your clothes in ! ( I come in from work at times and love that I can change my clothes here without feeling crammed ) 

Has a very pleasant wonderful vibe and that alone makes this place 5 star worthy and throw in that service it's like sprinkles on your fav cup cake - just can't be beat. If you live near by you have no excuse to go to star sucks - heck they even have a drive through !

I love copper star! They have the best earl grey tea ever. It is never bitter. Free refills all day long too! Their cupcakes are also terrific. I have had the strawberry and vanilla cupcakes and they are always moist and delicious.
Check this place out! Great coffee with a friendly staff and cool vibe. Not a hipster coffee house. Just an awesome place to come and grab a cup of coffee.

Could be the best Chai Tea Latte we have ever had! Spicy and full of flavor. The Americano was top notch with a very smooth roast. They will also make a Cubano Americano Style or Latte Style. Enjoyed a couple of excellent muffins as well. The staff was super friendly and upbeat. The dinning area was clean with plenty of room to sit or stand.

Every time I visit this coffee shop, I wish I lived closer! The building is adorable (converted gas station), they have free wifi and they are vegan-friendly. I hear wonderful things about their cupcakes, but I haven't checked to see if they carry vegan cupcakes. I did have a vegan apple cinnamon muffin there a while back that was delicious.

Supporting great local small businesses

I have always been a supporter of locally owned small business. So, I am always excited to find new businesses I haven't been to before and Copper Star Coffee was no exception.

Unlike, the chain coffee shops , Copper Star Coffee actually makes you feel welcomed.  The artwork on the walls grabs your attention and gives you something to look at while you wait on some of the  very best coffee you have ever had.  

Trust me, when I say, I love coffee. I am always trying out new coffee spots and Copper Star is serving up some of the very best.  Copper Star has the best Americano, hands down, the perfect mix of rich espresso and a light layer of crema. They also offer a  20 ounce drink sizes, so for the professional coffee drinker.

In addition, to a large variety of coffee and tea, Copper Star has a delicious display of muffins, brownies, scones, cinnamon rolls, cookies, and breakfast sandwiches. On my next visit I'll be sure to try a few.

If you're ever in the neighborhood, please check it out
and unlike that chain coffee shop, this is a local shop and you know you are supporting the local economy.






.

I have driven by this place for years and never stopped in.  Today was finally the day and I can kick myself for what I have been missing.  The drinks are great, and the food is even better.  The atmosphere is really laid back and all the employees really seem to love the place.  I will certainly make this place a regular stop from now on.

Visiting from out of town and we were looking for coffee and a quick breakfast bite. For the best of both worlds my friend and I split a breakfast bagel and a cinnamon roll. These were topped with a triple espresso. Mmmmmm...hit the spot. I'd take this place any day over starbucks. The interior is comfortable and homey.

Tried an iced cubano, was delicious!

But 3 stars for service---line went slow mostly because of returned food/drinks that were sent out with errors or just completely wrong. Staff was friendly about it, just made things inefficient, & I almost left due to the wait time but glad I stayed because the cubano was tasty. 

Parking was a bit of a hassle too, I had no idea where to park so parked at a business next door.

Might come back...not sure yet.

I'm writing this review from a comfie seat in the Copper Star cafe itself, using its free wifi. For a laptop-wielding downtown resident like myself, outlet accessibility is as important as wifi and this place gets the thumbs up. The owner and staff are very friendly. They seem genuinely delighted to see every customer walk in. The place is fairly packed and I recognize the faces of at least two fellow downtown professionals as I sit here. The coffee is good. The scones are excellent. The ambiance reflects exactly what I look forward to as the future of downtown Phoenix:  scaled down, unpretentious but urban; loft-like bricks and open ductwork. Given its proximity to my home, I'll probably spend many weeknights here when I have late projects.

i absolutely adore this little coffee shop off 7th ave. It can get super busy on the weekends and parking can be a little bit of a hassle however, the employees are wonderful, helpful, and the coffee is amazing!!
Cute little place! The lavender mocha is one of my favorites! The staff is nice always smiling.

I have been in super lock down mode for school work as this semester wraps up, and I got to really take a tour of this place while I worked here-I moved three times!

Yes really!

I got a ride here while my friend did a study group at ASU so I could give Lux a break and got down to laptopping and reading after buying a very good decaf soy latte. I settled down into my table and noticed the place didn't have a lot of buzz for a Friday during the day. 

About two hours into my work, a woman came in for a book signing wearing an unironic fanny pack and I moved so she could have the table.

Then I moved to the sofa but was distracted by the perfectly coifed guy on the sofa wearing a silk button down shirt a la most graduation photos circa 1993 kept muttering to himself how to improve his writing quite theatrically. 

I moved to another table when my laptop needed another boost from the outlet but then had a very harley davidson old man with what seemed like his granddaughter but looked like a runaway from Suicide Girls, pre-teen edition (she was wearing short shorts with thigh high socks and a big baggy sweatjacket-it was like 30 degrees out!) sat at the end while waiting for their orders to come though.

Finally, I ended up in the corner red chair to plug in again and my friend met up and we got another coffee and a snack. By that point, the place was starting to get packed and a family now at the table literally in front of me, the guy kept talking about his body-building competition, what he knew about computers, hooters (to which he talked about to his wife's PARENTS) forever forever forever forever....

We had to go after that and escaped to Lux.

The place itself is fine, the coffee and treats have been solid, but the people here are really distracting to me-therefore, it drops a star as a place to concentrate and do work.

Sorry! And I really hope that body building competition in two weeks gives you a chance to build some more bod to impress the waitresses at Hooters!

We had a 2-for-1 print out, good for up to $6.00, so we decided to come here for lunch and get sandwiches last Saturday.  On the menu board, there were 3 post-its on it saying "Out of Sandwiches". They told us that they stop serving sandwiches later in the day, so we ate some where else.
We decided to return the next day on Sunday, and the same 3 post-its were on the menu board again! We were not happy! We got there earlier than we did on Saturday. This time they told us that they are out of a lot of the items that are needed to make sandwiches, & they are awaiting their shipment. But they said that they could only make us Tuna Sandwiches...So we went ahead & got that.
This left us with a bad impression about this place & will most likely not return.

In the mean time, while we were in line....2 more customers walked in & noticed the post-its, too....They turned around & walked out.  Apparently, they are losing business by not having there 'shipment'. 
...The tuna sandwiches were quite dry, & not much flavor...

(....Hmmm, maybe they should just stick to coffee, cookies, & muffins.)
Cool place, great service,  was loomlking forward to the lavender coffee /late and was terribly dissapointed,  there was no lavender taste to be detected.  Sigh

This is the 2nd time this week I had this delicious coffee. Great place especially for a mom on the go! Cubano latte and the pastries were amazing. The girls at the drive thru this morning were so sweet and will keep me coming back !

Awesome wifi,  but........ The fruit flies almost dragged my law books away.  I felt like one of those poor children on the miracle network asking for donations....all I needed was a camera close up of me holding an empty cup, with  Puss n' Boots eyes and  the flies all over me.  Can we close the door and get an exterminator up in this joint?  Superior wifi....just don't eat anything here ...unless you like larva.

This is the place that I go to de-stress, to do homework, to celebrate a happy occasion.  I will take any excuse to go here.  I love that when I walk in I am always greeted with a smile and that there is never attitude.  The baked goods are irresistible but the coffee is what keeps me coming back.  There isn't a better soy latte in the entire valley.  It is deep but mellow and never, ever bitter.  I love CSC!!
This place attracts a diverse crowd of people, which is awesome. It's a great place to grab coffee and a tasty treat and get some work done on your laptop.

This place is a little hidden gem in Phoenix! Been meaning to try it for awhile, we saw it driving by after leaving another coffee shop awhile back. SO glad we were able to finally make it over here. Full menu, which I loved, as well as SO many options of pastries to choose from. The staff is AMAZING and ALL so nice! All the girls were so happy and upbeat and seemed genuinely excited to have us in for the first time (we told them). The Cubano is delicious! I like it better hot than cold and I get mine with almond milk. The ONLY teeny little part I did not like about this place was the charge for almond milk.. A lot of places don't do that anymore, it's usually just an option of milk to choose from - a little disappointing, but I would still come back. I got a little card to start collecting stamps, which I love any place that rewards returning customers. They even sell clothes and jewelry which was a unique, cool touch to this place. They have a drive through which I can not express how much I LOVE THAT! Can't wait to use that next time, for my first time in I wanted to go IN. All of their pastries are VERY large, and with a sweet tooth like mine, I can't wait to try everything they have! Hands down, great amazing place I was so happy to find. I put pictures on my snap chat that day and I got SO many people asking me where I went! Was happy to spread the word on this hidden gem, I look forward to telling more people!
I like this place but never had a proper customer service until today provided by Keylan (sorry if I spelled his name wrong). Very friendly and knowledgeable, thank you so much!

This is one of the best hidden gems I've discovered in the North Phoenix area. The coffee is amazing and you even get a free pastry on your first visit (the scones are to die for!). This place is very rustic and well worth the trip.

I love their scones.  I'm not a huge coffee drinker and I'll admit that I often review coffee houses based on their baked good offerings.  I enjoy supportin glocal businesses which is what is important to me.  The location is cute and they have free wifi.  Lots of people are seen working here with their laptops open with a scone before them.  Seriously, you need to get the cranberry scone.  Crumbling and crunchy on the outside.  Tender and perfectly balanced sweetness/tartness on the inside.  I'm hungry again ....

Everything we've tried so far has been delicious.  The cubano, lavender mocha and thai iced tea are all unique flavors.  Today we also indulged in a BLT and a vanilla cupcake with raspberry cream cheese frosting.  My favorite beverage so far is the cubano.  I love the amount of foam and flavor in the foam.  They leave the lid off of your drink and make a beautiful design in the foam.  I never really order a BLT, but I'm so glad I did!  The bacon is quality.  It's thick and meaty.  I would have liked a little less mayo, but nonetheless tasty.  The cupcake was beautiful to look at.  The cake was pretty plain, but was vanilla after all.  The raspberry cream cheese frosting made the cupcake.  All of the employees were friendly and cheerful.  My husband and I sat at the bar.  We were in awe as we watched the barista operate like a machine to make all of the drinks.  Even though they were fairly busy, the level of service never faultered.

SO... I was out looking for a WIFI place to study some boring insurance stuff and went to Star-rip off your-bucks. (I don't drink coffee so i can say this) and tried to use the free Internet....FAIL apparently you have to be a T-mobile type. 

I asked where I could go and the guy said there is a place next to the record store called Copper Star. 

Copper Star Coffee is cool, the place is cool, the clients are cool, the employees are cool, and I bet the coffee is HOT. I ordered a Coke in the bottle and used the free WIFI. 

I sort of wished I liked Coffee, I would gladly give them my money.

This place is amazing!  The atmosphere is very trendy, the staff if unheard of friendly and accommodating and the muffins are to die for.  They will make items for you that aren't even on their menu.  I am from MD and make a point of coming here when I visit AZ.

I stopped in here and told the barista that it was my first time here. She helped me select a drink that would be suitable for my tastebuds in addition to that she offered my boyfriend and I a free desert since it was our first time here. The ambiance is nice, it's actually bigger on the inside like a tardis and there are seats outside as well.

The Copper Star Coffee shop has several reviews already and without being too verbose and periphrastic, I will keep my review short.

Coffee ~ very good, full bodied taste without bitterness and has a good aroma.

Coffee Accompaniments ~ good selection of cookies, pastries, tarts.  I asked them to heat my brownie ; -) it was chocolicious X2!

Service ~ very friendly and happy and eager to please

Decor ~ it used to be much more comfy with more couches and big comfy chairs.  I think they are trying to accommodate more people with the use of big wooden tables and hard chairs. It used to be much more comfy with more room to move and set up better to meet with friends.  

All in all, it's a great place for a cup of joe if your in the area.  They have a convenient drive through if you don't have time to stop.
I think they have great coffee and pastries.  There hasn't been a time I visited that I wasn't happy with the results.

I had to update my rating to a full 5-stars for C-Star. Jenny and I have been consistently going there for nearly a year and neither of us has ever had a subpar visit. Seriously, they don't ever have an off day. I usually go weekday mornings -- never a problem. Jenny typically visits in the afternoons -- always treated well. More often than not, we go together on a weekend and lounge in the patio misters or on the big orange couches -- always a positive experience. The coffee is the best in the area (we recommended St Francis look to Copper Star to brew up b/c the reject grounds from Cartel are not cutting it) and the service is always excellent. The baked good and food selections make it just that much better. If this were the RenFaire, I'd be totally HUZZAH for Copper Star.

Huge points for unique atmosphere. This is a great "local" place with fresh made pastries, salads and goodies plus good beverages. And despite what others wrote, I had no problems with the wi-fi. This is for all the caffeine addicts who want a cool place to hang and have a coffee, but are completely over Starbucks. I have to throw in another comment about the atmosphere-this is what gives it the edge over the chains. Definitely worth checking out.

Coffee. Awesome. Scone. Delicious. Service? Perfect. P

Every coffee shop should have a drive thru for us poor sleep-deprived mamas. It's different in that they don't have a menu posted and they come up to your car to take your order. I decided to try their ice brewed coffee and it is so smooth. No burnt, sour or acidic taste. I asked the barista to add some cream and agave for me, with no other direction and it was perfect - not overly sweet like most places. 

I also ordered a cranberry-pecan scone because baked goods and coffee are meant to be consumed together. Uhm. The scone is bigger than my hand. Not that I have big hands, but still. It is a little on the drier side, but delicious! And as an added bonus, since it's my first visit, they bought my scone for me! Whaaaaat. If that's not amazing customer service, I don't know what is! 

As an added bonus, they have punch cards. Loooove. Will def be back, sleeping baby in tow!

This is my favorite coffee shop in midtown Phoenix. The coffee is very good mostly (sometimes when the staff turnover is higher it can make for inconsistent coffee). They have the best earl grey iced tea and a decent selection of sweets. The location is charming, it's a reused gas station where the fill up spots are now spots to order at as a drive thru. There are beautiful lush plants growing everywhere, there's a birdbath and outdoor/indoor seating. The atmosphere is very relaxed which makes me feel comfortable to come here first thing in the morning when I run out of coffee at home.

I was in the area and stopped in for a quick caffeine fix and this place is really great. The staff was super friendly, the coffee was good, and the atmosphere was really inviting. Next time I'll have to try the food.

This is my favorite coffee shop. Their coffee is great, the staff is always friendly and the atmosphere is very relaxed. I bring my dogs sometimes, and they are totally cool about them being there with me. The drive thru is pretty convenient, too when I'm in a hurry. I'd say it's hard to find a better cup of coffee for a better price in the area.

Amazing ambiance, gigantic and delicious pastries, and very welcoming atmosphere. Staff members are super nice, and the art exhibits are always a nice plus to the space. Their BLT is one of the best BLTs I ever had.

We came here today for coffee. The place was filled with people. There was a live band playing. The service was wonderful and the coffee was good. No reason to go to a chain coffee shop when if you are close to here.

The coffee here is quite good, and the pastries are pretty yummy. I'm a big fan of the staff here, they're always friendly and willing to banter, and they're exceedingly welcoming. There are some endearing quirks to the place as well. The occasional jazz band playing there in the mornings and mid afternoons is a nice touch.

As a note: if you're ordering an iced beverage, the choices are medium/large/extra large, which can be a bit confusing at first, especially for those of us who need caffeine to function. You adapt.

My one knock against the place would be to say that the geometry is awkward, at best. No truly clear place for the line to queue. The seating can be tricky if you want to be solo but not sit at the coffee bar. The patio is nice, but it can be trick to find a place to sit. There's street parking to be had, but you might have to park a block or so away (I personally don't mind the walk, but I can understand how it could get annoying in July).

Overall, a solid cafe, and my go-to in this part of Phoenix.

You want good coffee?  You want good service?  You want nice people?  You want convenient location?  You want easy in/out?  You want *free* WiFi?  You want good sandwiches?

You want Copper Star!

End of story!

I go here because it's in my hood. Only in the event someone wants to meet there etc. The coffee is meh...food is meh...service usually sucks. Unless you do drive thru. Bathrooms are dirty.
